t: For the director of music. For pipes. A psalm of David.
Listen*pn to my words, Lord,*s consider*ld my lament.
Hear*ln my cry for help, my*ld King and my God, for*ld to you I pray.
In*pn the morning, Lord,*s you hear my voice; in*ld the morning I lay my requests before you and*ld wait expectantly.
For*ln you are not a God who is pleased with wickedness; with*ld you, evil people are not welcome.
The*ln arrogant cannot stand in*ld your presence. You*ln hate all who do wrong;
you*ld destroy those who tell lies. The*ln bloodthirsty and deceitful you,*ld Lord,*s detest.
But*ln I, by your great love, can*ld come into your house; in*ln reverence I bow down toward*ld your holy temple.
Lead*pn me, Lord,*s in your righteousness because*ld of my enemiesâ€” make*ld your way straight before me.
Not*ln a word from their mouth can be trusted; their*ld heart is filled with malice. Their*ln throat is an open grave; with*ld their tongues they tell lies.
Declare*ln them guilty, O God! Let*ld their intrigues be their downfall. Banish*ln them for their many sins, for*ld they have rebelled against you.
But*ln let all who take refuge in you be glad; let*ld them ever sing for joy. Spread*ln your protection over them, that*ld those who love your name may rejoice in you.
Surely,*pn Lord,*s you bless the righteous; you*ld surround them with your favor as with a shield.
